reviews.text: We have just spent four days in Madrid. Hostal Luz couldn't have been more convenient for our purposes. The double room was clean and friendly with a nice shower room as well as impeccably working wifi. We were also much impressed with the three computers put at the guests disposal and made ample use of them to plan our daily sightseeing, shopping and entertainment. Margarita at the reception was very helpful and the whole hostal felt completely safe. The only negative issue was that Saturday night was marked by full blast music until the early hours (from somewhere up or down the street). As all the other nights were perfectly calm, this might have been an exception, or maybe one should just spend Satuday nights out partying like the locals. Anyhow, this wasn't a great problem (people having fun - hey, it's Madrid) and I warmly recommend the hostal to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent location, clean and safe

reviews.text: PS: I don't think that the statement made in an earlier review that taxis are not allowed near the hostal is correct. Although we preferred travelling by metro, we saw several taxis stopping right in front of Hostal Luz.

reviews.text: Friendly and helpful welcome to this tastefully decorated guest house from Margarita and her team. We were pleased that our room was quiet, with a window onto an internal light well; it had adequate storage and furniture and a spacious ensuite wc/shower room. No English is spoken, but we managed to communicate ok with our few words of Spanish and sign language.
reviews.title: The best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent for sightseeing, shops, bars and restaurants and less than 100 metres from the Opera metro station. A simple breakfast of coffee, freshly squeezed orange juice and a pastry is included - taken at the Traviata cafe/restaurant round the corner in the Plaza Opera, where you can also order a cooked breakfast (not included). The free wifi worked well and there are three large-screen computers available to use in the hallway.
reviews.title: Best hostal in Madrid!
Excellent Hotel for the Price and Location

very good location, very clean staff very nice and helpfull . the app are cute, the furniture is new, and have all needed, as safe, TV, air cond, hair dryer, and a wonderful shower.

reviews.title: I loved this hotel. The room was so cosy and the location just excellent!

reviews.text: Our stay at Hostal Luz was great. I traveled with two friends and, between the three of us, we stayed at Hostal Luz three times during our travels around southern Europe and through Madrid. The location near Plaza Espana and the metro stations at Plaza Opera (closest) and Plaza del Sol was wonderful, a great access point for exploring the city, especially on limited time, as we were. The hotel is a bit hard to locate at first and the proprietor/staff speak no English. But, they are very kind and helpful and we found no trouble. We would definitely stay at Hostal Luz again.
reviews.title: Great! Stayed twice and would again.

reviews.text: I stayed at Hostal Luz on July '11 for two days at a time, in rooms of different price ranges. Though some were a bit snug, all were meticulously clean and quiet at night, the bed was comfortable, there was free WiFi and two computer stations for the use of guests, and the air-conditioning provided a welcome refuge from the summer heat. The recently renovated higher-end rooms were also equipped with a safe. Plus, as opposed to most family hotels where I've stayed in the past, this one is equipped with an elevator! The staff, too, were very friendly and welcoming. As usual in Spain, a smattering of Spanish will get you a long way. A simple breakfast, included in the price of the hotel, was served at a nearby café between 08:00 and 12:00.
reviews.title: Value for money and superb location

reviews.text: All in all, I heartily recommend this hotel both for its excellent value for money and for its superb location: within walking distance of the Royal Palace and its gardens, the main shopping area, the San Miguel market, and several plazas. Metro line #2, just two minutes from the hotel, will take you straight to the museum area, the Botanical Gardens, and the Buen Retiro Park.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, just 5 mins. walk from Opera station. There's only one small signage hung outside of the room on top floor. It's a bit difficult to find it, especially at night. The room is clean and just like normal hotel. They provided hair dryer, towels...and they even provided 3 computers at common area. Room will be cleaned everyday. It's easily to reach the most of scenic spots. Margaritas is so nice.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: There's strange happened. We put all our valuable items into the in room safety box with our own password. When we came back, we found out that it can not be opened even we entered the correct password. Later, we asked help from the staff. One of the room attendant came but we can't actually communicate with her. Since she does not speak English. Then she suddenly entered 123456 on the safety box and it opened, but we sure that the 6 digit is not our password!!! How come she can open it by using that password??!?!!? After that we didn't use the safety box anymore, because it's UNSAFE!!!

reviews.text: This is a Hostal, more like a Pension, not a Hostel! You have your own room with a private bathroom. The place is clean and in an incredibly central location- between the Opera Metro stop, Plaza Sol, and Plaza Mayor. The woman who runs it is friendly, but does not speak much English, so brush up on your basic Spanish phrases! There are also computers & internet for guests to use free of charge. For 44 euros a night, this was a great deal!

reviews.text: This was better than a hotel, When I arrived in Hostal Luz I was surprised to see what looked like a petite boutique hotel, I thought I was in the wrong place. after chatting with Margarita she showed me that she also had single rooms available and for the price it was a definite no-brainer to take advantage of it. private bathroom, private fridge, in room safe, it was crazy. Like a hotel except for a fraction of the price.
